results.title: Out of slavery: 1619-1860
results.creator_credit: Alvin Yudkoff, Milton Meltzer and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Effective use of illustrations and still photographs, coupled with powerful music, to describe the period from the beginning of the slave trade with Africa to the election of Abraham Lincoln. Deals with the role of the War of Independence and the Declaration of Independence in the abolition of slavery. Also the growth of the southern cotton industry, underground railway, and northern abolitionists. Narrated by James Earl Jones. Suitable for upper primary and secondary school levels.

results.title: Out of Sight Out of Mind [Part 1]
results.creator_credit: David Goldie and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Part One (only) of the four-part series ‘Out of Sight, Out of Mind’.

This documentary, made for the ABC in 1987, helped to raise awareness about a much neglected section of our society. It provided extensive insight into the prison system, interviewing prisoners, prison officers and administrators.

The full work has four parts titled ‘Locked Up’, ‘Surviving in the Nick’, ‘The Keepers and the Kept’, and ‘The Cycle of Crime’. This program pulls no punches, describes the conditions of various correctional institutions around Australia and also offers some suggestions for improvements.

results.title: 20 Things to make and do = 20 fun things to make and do
results.creator_credit: Graham Peach, Ian Richardson, John Harry, Rob Sheerlock, James Lingwood, NWS Channel 9 (Adelaide, S. Aust.) and Science Craft
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Deane and Rob’s Curiosity Show collection”.
Deane Hutton and Rob Morrison from “The Curiosity Show” present twenty of their favourite activities. By following the step-by-step instructions viewers can make twenty different toys and games, using materials readily available around the house.

results.title: Dead poets society [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Paul Junger Witt, Steven Haft, Tony Thomas, Silver Screen Partners IV and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: When charismatic English professor John Keating (Robin Williams) arrives at a strict academy for boys, his unconventional teaching methods breathe new life into the curriculum steeped in tradition. With his wit and wisdom, Keating inspires his students to pursue individual passions and to make their lives extraordinary. (Awards: Academy Award winner for best original screenplay)

results.title: Out live = Bichunmoo
results.creator_credit: Kim Young-Jun, Lee Tae-Won, Yoo Jung-Ho and Taewan Entertainment
results.brief_description: The daughter of a concubine falls into a forbidden romance with a fearsome warrior of lowly descent. With her beloved feared dead, Sullie agrees to marry an evil Chinese warlord, under pressure from her corrupted father. Director Kim Young-Jun combines sweeping grandeur with exciting martial arts, and wire-work special effects (conjuring “Crouching tiger, hidden dragon”), to create a historical action picture. Based on the manga by Korean writer Kim Hye-rin. Cast includes: Shin Hyun-Joon and Kim Hee-Seon.

results.title: Out of bounds: Teenage sexual harassment
results.creator_credit: Donald R. Ham, Yvonne Harper and Coronet
results.brief_description: Aimed at teenagers this documentary explores what constitutes sexual harassment and what can be done to combat it. Sexual harassment is defined as unwanted tension of a sexual nature-attitude is portrayed as the biggest contributor. Issues such as what is defined as bad habits, whistling and joking etc and what to do if your the victim of sexual harassment are explored. The video also offers a solution to the problem- recognising that harassment has taken place and communication to recognise the boundaries of a relationship. The material is presented through a fictional case study which is narrated and commented on.

results.title: Out for a change: addressing homophobia in women's sports
results.brief_description: A documentary which addresses the issues of homophobia in women’s sports. In particular, homophobia is seen as a political tool which is used to control the lucrative sports industry. Interviews with aspiring young women athletes, coaches, administrators and professional athletes such as Zina Garrison-Jackson and Martina Navratilova offer a rare insight into the insidious nature of homophobia and how athletes can confront and deal with the problem.
